page.title: 14THE BURY AND SURROUNDINGS
page.content: The primary land cover around the area is farmland which is used for growing cereal crops. The secondary land cover is mainly residential. Recreational land covers the rest of the area, with many public foot-paths. The main housing area borders the farmland and there are many magnificent Oak and Copper Beech trees scattered around. Odiham Cricket Club is situated nearby. Buryfield Infants' School is in King Street, nearby in the Bury is the Mayfield Junior School. Near the school is the All Saints Parish Church surrounded by the churchyard. It is the largest church in the north-east of Hampshire. At present the tower is being repaired. The ancient Almshouses have recently been extended to house more elderly folk in Odiham. Nearby the Cottage Hospital has had a small, new, out-patients' department built.
